scam_categories.name: Facebook Marketplace Scams
scam_categories.description: Fraudulent listings and fake sellers on Facebook Marketplace
common_patterns: Requests for payment via bank transfer only
red_flags: Seller refuses to show product on video call
Unusual communication patterns or broken English
Listing price significantly below market value
report_steps: Contact your bank if payment was made

examples.title: iPhone 13 Pro (Brand New) - £300
examples.description: Seller refuses to meet in person, requests payment via bank transfer, then disappears

scam_categories.name: Romance Scams
scam_categories.description: Fraudulent relationships built to extract money from victims
common_patterns: Unable to video call or meet in person
Claims to be working abroad in military or oil industry
Sob stories leading to requests for money
Profile photos often stolen from models or military personnel
red_flags: Consistent excuses to avoid video calls
Claims to be wealthy but needs financial help
report_steps: Report profile to the platform (Facebook, dating site)
Contact your bank if payments were made
Save all conversations and photos as evidence

examples.title: Military Doctor in Syria
examples.description: Claims to be a US military doctor in Syria, falls in love quickly, then needs money for 'emergency surgery' or to come visit
red_flags: Claims to have large wealth but can't access it

scam_categories.name: Fake Parcel/Courier Scams
scam_categories.description: SMS and email scams claiming to be from delivery companies
common_patterns: Text messages claiming a failed delivery attempt
Links to fake courier websites (Royal Mail, DPD, Hermes)
Often claims package is held due to unpaid customs fees
red_flags: Poor spelling and grammar in messages
report_steps: Never click links in suspicious texts/emails
If you've entered card details, contact your bank immediately
Report to Action Fraud if money was taken

examples.title: Royal Mail Customs Fee
examples.description: Text claiming a parcel is held by customs and needs a £2.99 fee paid, links to fake Royal Mail website
